question.body: Nanomaterials that scientists study for biomedical applications are cleared by the liver, spleen, and the kidneys. What is the maximum size of nanomaterials that are cleared by the kidney?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Materials this small will be eliminated by the kidney, but this is not the maximum size; for scale, 0.5 nanometers is only about 5 atoms large.
Correct. Nanomaterials such as liposomes and gadolinium for MRI imaging pass through the kidneys.
Incorrect. Nanomaterials of this size will be cleared by other parts of the body; these nanomaterials are too large to pass through the glomerulus.
